definition: last day of a lunar month/dark/night
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: It was once believed that visitors to one's home could bring good or bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 人們曾經相信，來訪者可以帶來好運或晦氣。

sentences.english: I am unlucky enough to miss the last train.
sentences.chinese: 我真晦氣，錯過了末了一班火車。

sentences.english: She's said to be a jinx, who would bring bad luck to whoever she marries.
sentences.chinese: 有人說阿誰女人是個掃帚星，誰跟她成婚誰晦氣。

definition: to stir up trouble/to invite disaster
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to come to sb's door/to call on sb
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to take one's anger out on sb (who does not deserve it)
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
